title: Examining Extremism: Harakat al Shabaab al Mujahideen (al Shabaab)
description: The Transnational Threats Project’s Examining Extremism series provides an overview and assessment of al Shabaab—an Islamist insurgent group that has waged a protracted insurgency in Somalia and launched attacks on regional states in East Africa.

title: Why African Governments Are Accepting Afghan Refugees
description: Why are African states accepting Afghan refugees? Judd Devermont and Erol Yayboke share implications behind governments' moral and geopolitical considerations and provide recommendations for U.S. government response.

title: High-Tech Hajj
description: Pilgrims have been visiting Mecca since before the advent of Islam. The centuries-old tradition looked considerably different this year, and for more than one reason.

title: The Evening: Covid Summit, Terror Groups Rebuild, Blind Willie McTell and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Covid Summit, Terror Groups Rebuild, Blind Willie McTell and More

title: China Headaches for Iran Deal
description: Jon Alterman gives a commentary on China’s changing role in nuclear negotiations.

title: The Nuclear Policy Trilemma “Keynote Address by Senator Angus King”
description: ​Please join PONI on September 21 and 22, 2021, for a virtual two-day conference to explore the nuclear trilemma. Additional speakers to be announced shortly.

title: Press Briefing: Previewing the Quad Leaders Summit
description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) will host a press call on Wednesday, September 22, 2021 at 8:00 a.m. ET to preview the Quad Leaders Summit and reflect on the recent Australia-UK-U.S. alliance announcement.

title: The Evening: Biden at UN, Iran Fires Back, I and I, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Biden at UN, Iran Fires Back, I and I, and More.

title: Tunisia’s Popular Authoritarian
description: Jon Alterman talks with Monica Marks about Saied Kais's consolidation of power and what it means for Tunisia and democracy in the country.

title: Russia’s “Hybrid Aggression” against Georgia: The Use of Local and External Tools
description: This paper explores Russia’s use of local and external tools in its "hybrid aggression" against Georgia.

title: NASA’s Future In Low Earth Orbit: Considerations for International Space Station Extension and Transition
description: Todd Harrison, director of the Aerospace Security Project, director of Defense Budget Analysis, and senior fellow with the International Security Program, testifies before the House Science, Space and Technology Space and Aeronautics Subcommittee.

title: Russia’s New Frontier in Southeast Asia: Vaccine Diplomacy
description: Russia over the past year has engaged in a vigorous campaign of public diplomacy across Southeast Asia. Throughout this campaign, Russia has promoted its Sputnik V vaccine in the region, first as part of modest Covid aid donations but increasingly as larger sales.
